body: Just re-edit your remote and refresh the re-authorize now that you have it under the under ID.

```
└─> rclone config
Current remotes:

Name                 Type
====                 ====
xxxxxx

e) Edit existing remote
n) New remote
d) Delete remote
r) Rename remote
c) Copy remote
s) Set configuration password
q) Quit config
e/n/d/r/c/s/q> e
Choose a number from below, or type in an existing value
xxxxxxx
remote> 2
--------------------
xxxxxxx
--------------------
Edit remote
Value "client_id" = "xxxxxxx"
Edit? (y/n)>
y) Yes
n) No
y/n> n
Value "client_secret" = "xxxxxxxxx"
Edit? (y/n)>
y) Yes
n) No
y/n> n
Remote config
```
**_Already have a token - refresh?
y) Yes
n) No
y/n> Y_**
Thanks - unfortunately this is what I did for the error message to appear above :(

check to make sure you have the client id set in your rcline.conf.  I had a problem where it wouldn't save if you tried to refresh your token immediately after you added the clientid.  I had to not refresh it the first time through and then go back in and refresh it.

I had the same issue. Created my own client_id in Google API Manager, authorized - it worked with rclone and shortly after that it didn't work anymore. Tried to refresh it and again the same story. Indeed the client_id and the secret were not saved to the rclone.conf file. After adding them manually to the file, working properly again (didn't even need to refresh).

Overall this looks like a bug?

Not sure how it is supposed to work but I noticed that the token issued by gdrive had a very short time limit to it (less than a day for sure). So if rclone expects this token to be permanent and to use it instead of the client_id and the secret, this might be the reason why it doesn't work?
Yep. It's got to be a bug.  I had the same issue too. I had to quickly save my Comp file and then replace it shortly thereafter again
@calisro A bug in rclone or drive?  If rclone what do you think the problem is?

Rclone...  It seems to be either two rclone process clobbering the config file or the order to which a single rclone process writes to the config.  In my case I found that when adding a client id to an existing remote that when I walked through the config setup and added the client Id that if refreshed the auth in that same work flow it would succeed but not write the client id!  I found I had to go through the setup without refreshing the auth and exit then go back in and refresh and test the auth.

It is entirely possible I had other rclone process that wrote to the config in between though.

Perhaps it would make sense to separate transient auth tokens from the config so that there would be less clobbering? That would also help with losing the config data when space was at zero in the filesystem.

I think there's a bug in saving the config. I had an already existing "drive" type config. I went and edited it to use my own client_id and saved the config (I did not do multiple edits, I did not have multiple rclone config started, etc). It worked for a short while then I started getting unauthorized_client. Although I don't have logs I am pretty confident it worked with my own client_id for that session (I guess using a token generated during the config) because I was throttled on the default one.

Looking inside config file I see that I have empty client_id and client_secret.

rclone v1.36-22-gbc25190β, win64

Have the same problem with my own client_id and client_secret.
Is there any news or update for this problem?
Thanks for the hard work.

I, too, have my own API client_id and client_secret, and after about 27 minutes of uploading just fine with those credentials, I suddenly got a ton of 401 oauth2 errors as in the original issue. I've had this happen to me twice now, after reconfiguring. I am using a headless machine so I have to copy/paste the URL, etc. 

Since reading this I am going to look at the config file and make sure my info is there, which I suspect at this point it is not.

issue.title: Rclone fast upload, but slow checks

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
I backup my files to Google Drive. Everything works fine, upload speed is good (3-4MB/s).
But when all the files are uploaded, this takes 1-2 hours it runs an other 4-5 hours doing nothing then increasing checks. So whole backup runs over 6-7 hours. Can i do something against this long check part after uploading my new or changes files?


> What is your rclone version (eg output from `rclone -V`)
1.36

> Which OS you are using and how many bits (eg Windows 7, 64 bit)
Windows 10, 64 bit

> Which cloud storage system are you using? (eg Google Drive)
Google Drive

> The command you were trying to run (eg `rclone copy /tmp remote:tmp`)
rclone sync --backup-dir

> A log from the command with the `-vv` flag (eg output from `rclone -vv copy /tmp remote:tmp`)
2017/06/13 05:46:05 INFO  : 

Transferred:   2.101 GBytes (99.235 kBytes/s)
Errors:                 0
Checks:             95600
Transferred:          325
Elapsed time:   6h10m4.7s

2017/06/13 05:47:05 INFO  : 
Transferred:   2.101 GBytes (98.969 kBytes/s)
Errors:                 0
Checks:             95679
Transferred:          325
Elapsed time:   6h11m4.7s

2017/06/13 05:48:05 INFO  : 
Transferred:   2.101 GBytes (98.702 kBytes/s)
Errors:                 0
Checks:             95747
Transferred:          325
Elapsed time:   6h12m4.7s

2017/06/13 05:49:05 INFO  : 
Transferred:   2.101 GBytes (98.438 kBytes/s)
Errors:                 0
Checks:             95809
Transferred:          325
Elapsed time:   6h13m4.7s

body:
I had this issue multiple times. Heres how I worked around it.
1. delete .rclone.conf file in C:\Users\<user>\
2. run rclone config
3. configure rclone as usual

Problem seems to be rclone unable to update .rclone.conf file.

Yep. Same here. Editing the config through cli doesn't save the client_id and client_secret in the config file for some reason. I was only running one rclone process, so I'm not sure why. It worked when I manually added it in.

@DragonFury24 If you were running rclone on the same remote, then it will have overwritten your changes when it saved the token

The other issues in this ticket have been fixed now I think by
  * only changing the remote that rclone is running on
  * doing a two step save so it can't ever eave an empty config file

I had this problem, in that after use `rclone config` to change my account id and 'secret', rclone worked for a while with Gdrive and then generated 401 authorization errors. I repeated the `rclone config` procedure and now things are working - for longer than last time - but we'll see. And, ah, I find that my `rclone.config` file has blank entries for `client_id` and `client_secret`. Should I just paste the relevant data into there? But in what format? The `token` field has a syntax that involves braces . .

EDIT: but [apparently one should not mess with the config file at all . .](https://github.com/ncw/rclone/issues/572). I must say, getting rclone to work is no walk in the park.
Nothing wrong with editing the config file. Paste in your key and secret. I had to do that to get my own API to work.

@DragonFury24

Ah, well, if it works (despite what the page I linked says) then it works. But, as I wondered in my previous post, what's the syntax? Plain text? Text in quotation marks? Something else?

No quotes. Plain text.

On Mon, Aug 28, 2017, 1:28 PM CottonEaster <notifications@github.com> wrote:

> @DragonFury24 <https://github.com/dragonfury24>
>
> Ah, well, if it works (despite what the page I linked says) then it works.
> But, as I wondered in my previous post, what's the syntax? Plain text? Text
> in quotation marks? Something else?
>
> —
> You are receiving this because you were mentioned.
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
> <https://github.com/ncw/rclone/issues/1220#issuecomment-325419957>, or mute
> the thread
> <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AZlqnE35kLrNotOpbccrIFLaXuzZ12TCks5scvjWgaJpZM4MV-lo>
> .
>
OK, thanks - I'll do it if I have a breakage. Actually, I suppose I should do it now, because quite possibly rclone/Gdrive is using the wrong credentials at the moment, namely the generic ones.

While I have your ear, and if I may: do you know if it a good idea to impose [TPS limits](https://rclone.org/docs/#tpslimit-float) on rclone to Gdrive?

Looking at the Google API dashboard thing, it seems that, with *no* limiting, the number of requests from my computer does not go much above the 10 per second (and that the daily limit for requests would allow much more than I'll ever use in a day). *Still*, might things go faster if I imposed limits. I thought you might know the answer. Thanks for your help so far.
